title: Studious LMS Features and Workflows Worksheet
description: A MEDIUM-difficulty worksheet assessing understanding of Studious LMS core modules, workflows, collaboration features, and AI-assisted tools.

problems.question: Which Studious LMS feature ensures that schedules, classes, and events stay synchronized across the platform when changes are made?

points.requirements: Identify the Scheduling and Attendance module that keeps schedules synchronized across the platform.

problems.question: Explain how Studious supports the end-to-end academic workflow from assignment creation to grading, including deadlines, grading weights, and review via the platform.
problems.answer: Studious provides an end-to-end workflow: teachers create tasks with deadlines, define grading weights and clear instructions; students submit within the platform; teachers review and grade within the platform; built-in mark schemes and grading boundaries ensure consistency and fairness.

points.requirements: Describe the end-to-end workflow from task creation to grading, including deadlines, grading weights, submission, review, and the role of mark schemes.

problems.question: What mechanism in Studious provides real-time feedback and keeps discussions relevant across multiple active classes?
problems.answer: B) Lab Chats with AI-assisted support
options: B) Lab Chats with AI-assisted support

points.requirements: Identify the AI-assisted Lab Chats feature as the mechanism for real-time feedback across classes.

problems.question: Describe the file management workflow: uploading resources, student submissions, review and grading without leaving the platform, and the recovery mechanism in case of connection drops.
problems.answer: The file management workflow: a clear, secure file system for resources; uploads linked to relevant context; students submit work via the same interface; teachers review and grade inside the platform; uploads have progress indicators and automatic recovery; if a connection drops, Studious resumes uploads safely without data loss.

points.requirements: Explain the end-to-end file management workflow including uploads, submissions, review, and data recovery on interruptions.

problems.question: Discuss the role of AI-assisted Lab Chats in guiding problem-solving sessions and potential limitations.
problems.answer: Lab Chats connect to a class for AI-assisted guided discussions or problem-solving sessions; potential limitations include AI accuracy issues, possible over-reliance, and the need for human oversight and privacy considerations.

points.requirements: Explain the purpose of Lab Chats and identify at least two potential limitations.

problems.question: Which module would a teacher use to connect a class event to an assignment and automatically update attendance history?

points.requirements: Identify Scheduling and Attendance as the module that links events to assignments and updates attendance history.

problems.question: Propose a plan for evaluating student participation and attendance trends using the built-in attendance history and reporting features.
problems.answer: Plan: collect attendance history to compute participation trends; analyze per class, subject, or student; track patterns over time; use reports to identify at-risk students; correlate attendance with assignment submissions and performance; set improvement targets and monitor dashboards; produce periodic summaries for stakeholders.

points.requirements: Describe a plan that uses attendance history and reports to identify trends and at-risk students, including actions to improve attendance.

problems.question: Assess how the built-in announcements and messaging features support real-time alignment between teachers and students, including use-cases like reminders, feedback, and attachments.
problems.answer: The built-in announcements provide real-time updates to all students; messaging supports one-on-one and group conversations; mentions and notifications ensure messages are seen; attachments enable sharing of study materials and feedback; use-cases include posting reminders for assignments, sharing feedback on submissions, and distributing attachments linked to lessons.

points.requirements: Explain how announcements and messaging enable real-time communication and give practical use-cases.
